screens._doc: SEGMENT BRIDGE — first personalized hit. Research-based stats per segment.
screens.title: You're not alone.

cases.busy_parent:
The average parent makes 12+ food decisions daily.
That's over 4,000 a year — no wonder you're drained.
cases.health_focus:
87% of people who start meal prepping quit within 2 months.
The problem isn't motivation — it's monotony.
cases.busy_pro:
After 35,000+ micro-decisions at work, "what's for dinner?" breaks the camel's back.
It's decision fatigue, not laziness.
cases.budget:
The average household throws away 30% of groceries.
That's like tossing €1 out of every €3 you spend.

dynamicText.default: Most people struggle with the same thing. Let's change that.

infoCards.label: The Math
infoCards.body:
Average family: 4.5 hours/week on food planning + cooking.
That's 10 full days a year you'll never get back.

infoCards.label: The Good News
infoCards.body: With a prep system, most families cut that time in half — and eat better.

screens._doc: INSIGHT MIRROR — the PEAK MOMENT. 3 colored cards with heavy dynamic text per segment.
screens.title:
Here's what
we discovered:

cases.busy_parent: You're making {decisionsPerYear}+ food decisions per year. That's {daysPerYear} full days of mental energy — just on "what should we eat?"
cases.health_focus: You're spending {prepHoursPerWeek}+ hours per week on meal prep. That's {prepDaysPerYear} full days a year — and it still falls apart by Thursday.
cases.busy_pro: You're spending €{weeklyTakeoutSpend}/week on unplanned food. That's €{yearlyTakeoutSpend} a year — more than most vacations.
cases.budget: You're wasting ~€{monthlyWasteAmount}/month on food that spoils. That's €{yearlyWasteAmount} a year — literally money in the bin.

dynamicText.default: Your current food routine costs more than you realize — in time, money, and energy.

cases.improvise: You start strong, but by Wednesday you're winging it — which brings back all the stress you were trying to avoid.
cases.food_spoils: Your plans derail when food spoils. This isn't about planning better — it's about a 4-day freshness cycle instead of 7.
cases.exhausted: By midweek, you're too exhausted to follow through. That's not a discipline problem — it's a system problem.
cases.never_tried: You haven't found a system realistic enough to try. Most plans assume time and energy you don't have.

dynamicText.default: Your current approach hits a wall by midweek.

cases.decisions: Your entire week is planned. Just open and assemble. No thinking required.
cases.healthy: Nutritious meals that actually taste good. No willpower needed.
cases.no_waste: 4-day freshness cycle. Two prep sessions mean nothing sits long enough to spoil.
cases.save_time: 5-minute assembly. Components are ready. You just combine and serve.
cases.freshness: A 4-day cycle means nothing sits long enough to spoil. Shop twice, waste nothing.
cases.easy_meals: Pre-prepped components. Zero decisions. Just grab, combine, eat.
cases.picky_eaters: Same base ingredients, different presentations. Everyone eats, nobody complains.
cases.school_lunches: Every meal packs perfectly. No reheating needed. Mornings become easy.
cases.flexibility: Swap meals, adjust portions, life happens — the system adapts with you.
cases.variety: Different flavors every day from the same base prep. Never boring.
cases.no_tracking: Macros built into every meal. No counting, no spreadsheets.
cases.zero_effort: Open fridge, grab container, eat. That's the whole process.
cases.smart_shopping: One precise list, two shopping trips, zero waste.

dynamicText.default: We'll build your plan around what matters most to you.
